page.title: 08Modernisation v Conservation
page.content: East Grinstead was a Market town built using traditional methods and materials.Many old buildings are being replaced by new which do not always fit in.Concern was shown about the siting of new buildings,for example, the new block to the north of St.Swithen's Church.Many believed that current planning ideas could lead to East Grinstead becoming like other modern industrial towns. Concern was also shown about litter giving a bad impression of the town to visitors,particulaly in the locality of the cinema,railway station and arcade by Sainsbury's. Many approved of the use made of the old railway line,now Worth Way Nature Reserve, but there was a feeling that much more could be done to educate the public about conservation.
